greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the imaginary part of f(n) = Sum_{d_k > 0} 3^k * i^(d_k-1) where Sum_{k >= 0} 5^k * d_k is the base 5 representation of n and i denotes the imaginary unit. Sequence A332412 gives real parts.
link: Rémy Sigrist, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..15624
formula: a(n) = 0 iff the n-th row of A031219 has neither 2's nor 4's.
xref: Cf. A031219, A289814, A332412 (real parts and additional comments).
results.author: _Rémy Sigrist_, Feb 12 2020
